channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. approaching 340 mass shootings this year after deadly weekend
item.description: Twelve people were killed, and at least 40 people were injured after shootings marred three different high school events in two states over the weeken...

item.title: Scoop: Direct meeting between Trump envoys and Hamas leaders sealed Gaza deal
item.description: An unusual and dramatic meeting last Wednesday between President Trump's envoys and Hamas leaders helped get the Gaza peace deal across the line, thre...

item.title: Trump urges pardon for Netanyahu during Gaza address to Knesset
item.description: During his address to the Israeli parliament on Monday, President Trump went off script and urged President Issac Herzog to pardon Prime Minister Benj...

item.title: Trump, Zelensky to discuss Tomahawks for Ukraine at White House Friday
item.description: President Trump is expected to meet with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky at the White House on Friday, two sources familiar with the planning t...

item.title: JPMorgan announces $1.5 trillion U.S. investment initiative
item.description: JPMorgan announced Monday that it's planning a $1.5 trillion investment initiative aimed at bolstering sectors critical to the U.S. economy over the n...

item.title: Airports say they won’t air Kristi Noem shutdown video at TSA checkpoints
item.description: Travelers in Cleveland, L.A., Phoenix, Seattle and other cities will not see the footage, which blames congressional Democrats for shutdown-related fl...

item.title: Historic wave of retirements is putting huge strains on the government
item.description: Tens of thousands of federal employees have taken retirement or other voluntary departures on top of the Trump administration’s latest layoffs.

item.title: Congress is losing its grip on the power to spend Americans’ money
item.description: Congress is supposed to control spending, but increasingly, the White House is dictating how America’s money is used.

item.title: Trump eyes transformational Mideast peace as Israel, Arabs stay miles apart
item.description: The challenge of turning a Gaza ceasefire into a lasting regional peace was on display as Trump made separate stops in Israel and Egypt.

item.title: Will Gaza deal get him into heaven? Trump fears not.
item.description: The 79-year-old president, who has repeatedly pondered the afterlife in recent months, told reporters on Air Force One: “I think I’m not, maybe, heave...

item.title: Trump's approval holds steady despite unpopular policies, per new NYT poll
item.description: Trump’s strength with Republicans on the economy could prove to be a boon for the GOP.

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Trump is selling a strong economy. Voters aren’t buying it.
item.description: Privately, aides concede voters remain uneasy about prices but argue their policies are beginning to turn things around.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
